snippet: The Michigan attorney general has released an opinion that says the Detroit Institute for the Arts could not sells any of its art as part of a bailout plan for the financially troubled city.
abstract: The Michigan attorney general has released an opinion that says the Detroit Institute for the Arts could not sells any of its art as part of a bailout plan for the financially troubled city.

headline.main: Michigan Attorney General Says Detroit Museum Could Not Sell Art
headline.print_headline: Detroit Art Is Not for Sale
